channel.title: Dhurba Adhikari – Asians in the U.S.

item.title: Primary reader (Racial Triangulation)
item.dc:creator: Dhurba Adhikari
item.description: Chaire Jean Kim’s article is based on racialize minorities in America since 1850s. She states that white majorities are responsible for ordering the racial group which means white considered the racial position of minorities in the society. Both Blacks and Asians were “degenerated” as inferiority and foreigners respectively. Some cases Blacks and Asian were treated equally lower such as […]
item.content:encoded: Chaire Jean Kim’s article is based on racialize minorities in America since 1850s. She states that white majorities are responsible for ordering the racial group which means white considered the racial position of minorities in the society. Both Blacks and Asians were “degenerated” as inferiority and foreigners respectively. Some cases Blacks and Asian were treated equally lower such as some laws for black civic were same for Chinese and Chinese labor were also treated as slave; otherwise; Black were consider more inferior than Asians. Still, Asians also went through miserable condition in white dominated society. Overtime, Asian success in the American society economically, culturally and education achievements which increased there social valorization in comparison to Black race.

item.title: South Asians and Race formation (Research #2)
item.dc:creator: Dhurba Adhikari
item.description: This link below is a Journal which is related to Omi and Winant’s work and even there research is included in this writing. I think to understand the racial formation in the United State this article is helpful. In general this writing deals with the racial self- identification of South Asian. http://as.nyu.edu/docs/IO/1043/S.Asian.Race.ID.JEMS.January.2001.pdf
item.content:encoded: This link below is a Journal which is related to Omi and Winant’s work and even there research is included in this writing. I think to understand the racial formation in the United State this article is helpful. In general this writing deals with the  racial self- identification of South Asian.    http://as.nyu.edu/docs/IO/1043/S.Asian.Race.ID.JEMS.January.2001.pdf
